Questions.QuestionString: 1. The pneumatic system pump is a. (Level 1)

2. Is it possible to operate the pneumatic system if an engine bleed air system failure
occurs and the APU is not available? (Level 1)
Answers: A. Yes, it is, only the cross-bleed valve has to be opened.
B. No, if APU is not available, the system can’t be operated.

C. Yes, the consumers are operational in every situation no matter what the switch positions
are.

Questions.QuestionString: 3. The unit of duct pressure shown in air synoptic page is (Level 1)
4. Can you control the high pressure valve from the cockpit: (Level 1)
5. At high engine speed the high pressure valve is: (Level 1)
6. At high engine speed the high pressure valve is: (Level 1)
7. At high engine speed the high pressure valve is: (Level 1)
8. In a pneumatic system, the maintainer valve will be fitted in supply lines to. (Level 2)
9. Two compressors driven by separate engines use. (Level 2)
Answers: B. NRVs to prevent compressors driving each other.

Questions.QuestionString: 10. What is important about the air entering a dry air pump?. (Level 2)
Answers: B. It must be pressure controlled.
C. It must be temperature controlled.

Questions.QuestionString: 11. What type of compressor is used on a pneumatic system?. (Level 2)
12. High pressure pneumatic source is a. (Level 1)
13. Aircraft pneumatic energy is used for: (Level 2)
Answers: A. Engine starting, cabin pressurization and air conditioning wing anti—icing.
B. Fuel reservoir pressurization and hydraulic reservoir pressurization.

C. Engine starting, cabin pressurization and air conditioning wing anti—icing and Water
reservoir pressurization and hydraulic reservoir pressurization.

Questions.QuestionString: 14. What is meant by the term Bleed Air? Does it mean that… (Level 2)
Answers: A. The pneumatic system is pressurized with external connector from ground air car.
B. There is a leakage which lets air bleed.
C. Air is bled from the engines.

Questions.QuestionString: 15. Where does the cooling air come from? (Level 2)
Answers: A. The air conditioning system is used to cool the engine bleed air.
B. Fan air is used to cool the bleed air.
C. Air is used to cool the engine bleed air.

Questions.QuestionString: 16. What is the main reason for monitoring the ducts? (Level 2)
Answers: A. This is simply a standard on aircraft.
B. A leakage can cause damage to its environment.
C. The hydraulic pressure may break down.

19. Is it possible to operate the pneumatic system if an engine bleed air system failure
occurs and the APU is not available? (Level 2)
Answers: A. Yes, it is, only the cross-bleed valve has to be opened.
B. No, if ENG is not available, the system can’t be operated.

C. Yes, the consumers are operational in every situation no matter what the switch positions
are.

24. At high engine speed the high pressure valve is: (Level 2)

26. The purpose of check air valve is: (Level 2)
Answers: C. To prevent backflow and regulate air pressure

Questions.QuestionString: 27. On the ground,the pneumatic system can be supplied with: (Level 2)
28. When the moisture separator is purged in a pneumatic system, it dumps. (Level 3)
Answers: C. the system between compressor and regulator valve.

Questions.QuestionString: 29. If the pneumatic water drain trap is left open for a long time it will drain. (Level 3)
Answers: A. between the compressor and the PRV.

Questions.QuestionString:
30. On a high pressure pneumatic system, if the drain plug for oil and water is left open for
long periods of time, the system would. (Level 3)
Answers: A. lose pressure from the compressor side only.

Questions.QuestionString: 31. Which statement is correct? (Level 3)
Answers:
A. Air pressure is bled at a lower compressor stage through a bleed port then the bleed air
pressure is lower and when it is bled at a higher compressor stage then the bleed air
pressure is higher.

B. Air pressure is bled at a lower compressor stage through a bleed port then the bleed air
pressure is higher and when it is bled at a higher compressor stage then the bleed air
pressure is lower.

C. Air pressure is bled at a highter compressor stage through a bleed port then the bleed air
pressure is higher and when it is bled at a higher compressor stage then the bleed air
pressure is lower.

Questions.QuestionString: 32. The role of the pneumatic controller is: (Level 3)
Answers: A. To monitor pressure, temperature, leaks, the operation of the engine components.

B. To monitor pressure, temperature, leaks, the operation of the pneumatic & engine
components.
C. To monitor pressure, temperature, leaks, the operation of the pneumatic components

Questions.QuestionString: 33. A high pressure bleed air port is only needed at (Level 3)
Answers: C. Low and high engine spee

Questions.QuestionString: 34. Aircraft pneumatic energy is used for: (Level 1)
Answers: A. Engine starting, cabin pressurization and air conditioning wing anti—icing.
B. Water reservoir pressurization and hydraulic reservoir pressurization.

C. Engine starting, cabin pressurization and air conditioning wing anti—icing and Water
reservoir pressurization and hydraulic reservoir pressurization.

Questions.QuestionString: 35. A fan air valve is used: (Level 3)
Answers: A. To allow more fan air to pass the precooler
B. To allow less fan air to pass the precooler
C. To allow more or less fan air to pass the precooler

Questions.QuestionString: 36. A built-in precooler is used: (Level 3)
Answers: A. To heat the engine bleed air
B. To cool the engine bleed air.
C. To cool or heat the engine bleed air depend on engine speed.

Questions.QuestionString: 37. Which statement is correct? (Level 3)
Answers:
A. Air pressure is bled at a lower compressor stage through a bleed port then the bleed air
pressure is lower and when it is bled at a higher compressor stage then the bleed air
pressure is higher.

B. Fuel pressure is bled at a lower compressor stage through a bleed port then the bleed air
pressure is higher and when it is bled at a higher compressor stage then the bleed air
pressure is lower.

C. Air pressure is bled at a highter compressor stage through a bleed port then the bleed air
pressure is higher and when it is bled at a higher compressor stage then the bleed air
pressure is lower.

Questions.QuestionString: 38. Which statement is correct? (Level 3)
Answers:
A. Air pressure is bled at a lower compressor stage through a bleed port then the bleed air
pressure is lower and when it is bled at a higher compressor stage then the bleed air
pressure is higher.

B. Air pressure is bled at a lower compressor stage through a bleed port then the bleed air
pressure is higher and when it is bled at a higher compressor stage then the bleed air
pressure is lower.

C. Fuel pressure is bled at a highter compressor stage through a bleed port then the bleed air
pressure is higher and when it is bled at a higher compressor stage then the bleed air
pressure is lower.

Questions.QuestionString: 39. The role of the pneumatic controller is: (Level 3)
Answers: A. To monitor temperature, leaks, the operation of the engine components.

B. To monitor pressure, temperature, leaks, the operation of the pneumatic & engine
components.
C. To monitor pressure, temperature, leaks, the operation of the pneumatic components

Questions.QuestionString: 40. A high pressure bleed air port is only needed at (Level 3)
Answers: C. Low and high engine speed.

Questions.QuestionString: 41. A fan air valve is used: (Level 3)
Answers: A. To not allow more fan air to pass the precooler
B. To allow less fan air to pass the precooler
C. To allow more or less fan air to pass the precooler

Questions.QuestionString: 42. A built-in precooler is used: (Level 3)
Answers: A. To heat the engine bleed fuel.
B. To cool the engine bleed air.
C. To cool or heat the engine bleed air depend on engine speed.

Questions.QuestionString: 43. When the moisture separator is purged in a pneumatic system, it dumps. (Level 3)
Answers: C. the system between air compressor and regulator valve.

Questions.QuestionString: 44. What is meant by the term Bleed Air? Does it mean that… (Level 1)
Answers: A. The pneumatic system is pressurized with external connector from ground air cart.
B. There is a leakage which lets air bleed.
C. Air is bled from the engines.

Questions.QuestionString: 45. Where does the cooling air come from? (Level 1)
Answers: A. The air conditioning system is used to cool the engine bleed air.
B. Fan air is used to cool the bleed air.
C. Ram air is used to cool the engine bleed air.

Questions.QuestionString: 46. What is the main reason for monitoring the ducts? (Level 1)
Answers: A. This is simply a standard on aircraft.
B. A leakage can cause damage to its environment.
C. The pneumatic pressure may break down.

Questions.QuestionString: 47. In flight, The pneumatic system can be supplied with: (Level 1)
48. 6.Compressed air is bleed form: (Level 1)
49. What is the pneumatic energy used for main system of aircraft?
Answers:
A. 1. Engines starting.
2. Cabin pressurization and air conditioning.
3. Wing anti-icing.
4. Water reservoir pressurization.
5. Hydraulic reservoir pressurization.

B. 1. Engines starting.
3. Wing anti-icing.
4. Water reservoir pressurization.
5. Hydraulic reservoir pressurization.

C. 1. Engines starting.
2. Cabin pressurization and air conditioning.
5. Hydraulic reservoir pressurization.

Questions.QuestionString:
50. In the pneumatic system, does air pressure and temperature always change in the
different consumers?
51. How many the pneumatic sources supply the air pressure for the aircraft?
52. How many the pneumatic sources supply the bleed air during flight?
53. What does EBA stand for?
54. For engines bleed air, how many stages supply bleed air?
55. Do we need the pressure regulator valve for APU bleed air supply?
Answers: C. Yes, combine with a check valve

Questions.QuestionString: 56. Can we use directly bleed air from engines for air conditioning?
Answers: B. Can use with a pre-cooler
C. Can not use at all

Questions.QuestionString: 57. How can cool down the bleed air from engines?
Answers: C. Via a pre-cooler by Fan air

Questions.QuestionString: 58. Which component allows to transfer Bleed air from one engine to other one?
59. How can you know leak in pneumatic duct?
Answers: C. Check the pressure value in duct system

Questions.QuestionString: 60. How is the pneumatic system controlled?
Answers:
C. Either manually via the pneumatic control panel in the cockpit or automatically by the
pneumatic controller.

Questions.QuestionString: 61. Bleed valve is which kind of valve?
Answers: A. A butterfly type and pneumatic operated
B. Solid type with pneumatic operated
C. Butterfly type with electric operated

Questions.QuestionString: 62. What kind of valve to protect the pneumatic system by too high pressure built up?

63. Where are the overheat detection sensors installed?
1. the pylon ducts.
2. the pneumatic wing ducts.
3. the ducts in the fuselage.
4. the APU duct.
